TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed HashIdentity extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Common notions of value identity used with hash tables.

Docs.param: A function to generate a hash code from a value.
A function to test equality of two values.
Docs.summary: Hash using the given hashing and equality functions.
Docs.returns: An object implementing IEqualityComparer using the supplied functions.

MemberSignature.Value: public static System.Collections.Generic.IEqualityComparer<T> Reference<T> () where T : class;
.method public static class System.Collections.Generic.IEqualityComparer`1<!!T> Reference<class T>() cil managed
Public Shared Function Reference(Of T As Class) () As IEqualityComparer(Of T)
Microsoft.FSharp.Collections.HashIdentity.Reference : unit -> System.Collections.Generic.IEqualityComparer<'T (requires 'T : null)> (requires 'T : null)

Docs.summary: Physical hashing (hash on reference identity of objects, and the contents of value types). Hash using LanguagePrimitives.PhysicalEquality and LanguagePrimitives.PhysicalHash, That is, for value types use GetHashCode and Object.Equals (if no other optimization available), and for reference types use System.Runtime.CompilerServices.RuntimeHelpers.GetHashCode and reference equality.
